intro: Hieracium hraunense, commonly known as the Hraunense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, disc-like cluster. Hieracium hraunense is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat.
